item.title: ;Not in use' cover missing., 13th August
item.description:
The bus stop does not have your normal 'not in use' cover over it, but your website says it is out of use until 2 September. Please put the cover on.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 136-138, Sloane Street, Chelsea, London

item.title: Dames drain cover, 13th August
item.description:
In Osidge Lane, at the junction withEast Walk, there is a drain cover which is “sticking up” instead of lying flat. Although not a major danger for cars etc. it is a significant danger for cyclists since part of the drain is uncovered. I did not notice if the cover was broken.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 68, East Walk, Brunswick Park, London

item.title: Pepe's commercial waste left on pavement again, 13th August
item.description:
Pepe's shop keep leaving commercial waste of pavement and overflowing bins, which is against the law and council commercial waste disposal rules. They need to be penalised or closed, as this behaviour is like that in the last 18 months. This is bringing rats to the area. They need to leave the area. No other shop on this are does that.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Woolwich Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Big trees in front of the property that create mess, 13th August
item.description:
I would like to report two large trees located directly in front of our property and request maintenance due to the ongoing issues they are causing. Throughout the year, in different seasons, these trees drop large amounts of leaves, seed pods, and small black debris into our front yard. When it is windy, this debris is blown through our windows and into the house — even reaching the second floor at the back of the property. This creates a constant mess, blocks our drains, and regularly fills our brown bin to capacity. As we pay for the brown bin service to dispose of garden grass clippings, there is often no space left for our own waste. Our grass cuttings are now having to be stored at the back of the garden, which is unacceptable. The trees have grown too large, and several branches are now overhanging into our courtyard, which increases the debris and makes the area harder to keep clean. At present, the entire front yard, as well as the public area and street in front of our house, are covered in leafy droppings. We kindly request to arrange for proper pruning and general maintenance of these trees to reduce the debris and prevent further blockage of drains.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wansunt Road, Coldblow, London
Report on FixMyStreet
